keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planned to 'shoot it up' at the airport.
Although Cagle was not armed at the time of arrest, an AR-15 assault rifle was found in his vehicle parked outside the airport.

He faces multiple felony charges, including terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assaults, possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.

Cagle had a prior conviction for marijuana possession over two decades ago and is described as mentally challenged, which authorities say combined with his possession of a semi-automatic weapon, created a potentially deadly scenario.
The incident occurred at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, the world’s busiest airport, which handles over 108 million passengers annually and is the hub for Delta Air Lines.
The FBI is assisting in the investigation, and the Atlanta Police Department credited family vigilance and early reporting for averting a tragedy.

Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem publicly expressed gratitude that no harm occurred, highlighting the broader significance of public awareness and law enforcement coordination in preventing terrorism-like incidents.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up' at the airport. Though not armed at the time of arrest, an AR-15 assault rifle was found in his vehicle. Cagle, who has a prior marijuana conviction and is described as mentally challenged, faces multiple felony charges including terroristic threats and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon. Authorities credit early reporting by family members and inter-agency cooperation—including Cartersville and Atlanta police and the FBI—for preventing a potential tragedy. The incident occurred at the world’s busiest airport, which is the hub for Delta Air Lines, and was publicly praised by Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem for being averted. This event underscores the importance of vigilance, mental health awareness, and coordinated law enforcement response in high-traffic public spaces.
title: Man Arrested Inside Atlanta Airport After Making Threats to 'Shoot It Up'
